description.zh-cn: 一家美国跨国投资银行与金融服务公司，总部位于纽约市曼哈顿。
description.en: An American multinational investment bank and financial services company headquartered in New York City.

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团公司的创始人之一。
description.en: Co-founder of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团公司的创始人之一。
description.en: Co-founder of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团公司现任董事长兼首席执行官。
description.en: Current Chairman and CEO of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团公司总裁兼首席运营官。
description.en: President and COO of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团公司执行副总裁兼首席财务官。
description.en: Executive Vice President and CFO of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 一场由美国次级抵押贷款市场问题引发的全球性金融危机。
description.en: A global financial crisis triggered by problems in the U.S. subprime mortgage market.

description.zh-cn: 一场在2007年-2008年爆发的全球性金融危机，对全球经济造成了严重影响。
description.en: A global financial crisis that occurred in 2007-2008, causing severe impacts on the global economy.

description.zh-cn: 美国政府为应对2008年金融危机而设立的一项计划，旨在购买和担保金融机构的问题资产。
description.en: A program created by the U.S. government in response to the 2008 financial crisis to purchase and insure troubled assets from financial institutions.

en: United States Department of the Treasury

description.zh-cn: 美国联邦政府的一个行政部门，负责管理联邦财政事务。
description.en: An executive department of the U.S. federal government responsible for managing federal finances.

description.zh-cn: 2008年美国国会通过的一项法案，授权美国财政部实施“问题资产救助计划”。
description.en: An act passed by the U.S. Congress in 2008, authorizing the Treasury Department to implement the Troubled Asset Relief Program.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物和银行家，曾任美国财政部长，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: American politician and banker, former U.S. Secretary of the Treasury, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 美国银行家和政治人物，曾任美国财政部长，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: American banker and politician, former U.S. Secretary of the Treasury, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 美国投资银行家和政治人物，曾任美国财政部长，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: American investment banker and politician, former U.S. Secretary of the Treasury, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 美国投资银行家，曾任美国国家经济会议主席，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: American investment banker, former Director of the National Economic Council, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 意大利经济学家和政治家，曾任欧洲中央银行行长，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: Italian economist and politician, former President of the European Central Bank, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 欧盟欧元区的中央银行。
description.en: The central bank for the euro area of the European Union.

description.zh-cn: 加拿大经济学家，曾任加拿大银行总裁和英格兰银行总裁，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: Canadian economist, former Governor of the Bank of Canada and the Bank of England, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 加拿大的中央银行。
description.en: The central bank of Canada.

description.zh-cn: 英国的中央银行。
description.en: The central bank of the United Kingdom.

description.zh-cn: 澳大利亚政治家，曾任澳大利亚总理，也是高盛集团的前雇员。
description.en: Australian politician, former Prime Minister of Australia, and a former employee of Goldman Sachs.

nodes.id: 一个马来西亚发展有限公司丑闻

zh-cn: 一个马来西亚发展有限公司丑闻

description.zh-cn: 一起涉及马来西亚主权财富基金“一个马来西亚发展有限公司”（1MDB）的重大贪腐丑闻。
description.en: A major corruption scandal involving the Malaysian sovereign wealth fund, 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB).

description.zh-cn: 东南亚国家，高盛因一马公司丑闻与其达成和解。
description.en: A country in Southeast Asia with which Goldman Sachs reached a settlement over the 1MDB scandal.

description.zh-cn: 欧亚大陆北部的联邦共和国，高盛计划逐步结束在该国的业务。
description.en: A federal republic in northern Eurasia where Goldman Sachs plans to wind down its operations.

description.zh-cn: 由巴西、俄罗斯、印度和中国组成的新兴市场国家的概念，由高盛在2003年的一份报告中首次提出。
description.en: A concept for the emerging market countries of Brazil, Russia, India, and China, first proposed in a 2003 report by Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 由高盛在2005年提出，指代11个具有高增长潜力的新兴市场国家。
description.en: A concept introduced by Goldman Sachs in 2005, referring to 11 emerging market countries with high growth potential.

nodes.id: 高盛 (亚洲) 有限责任公司

zh-cn: 高盛 (亚洲) 有限责任公司

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团在亚洲的业务分支。
description.en: The Asian business arm of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 中国企业家，曾在高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司工作。
description.en: Chinese entrepreneur who previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 中国投资者，曾在高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司工作。
description.en: Chinese investor who previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 曾在高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司工作。
description.en: Previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 曾在高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司工作。
description.en: Previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 美国跨国投资银行和金融服务公司，是高盛的竞争对手。
description.en: An American multinational investment bank and financial services company, and a competitor of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 美国跨国投资银行和金融服务控股公司，是高盛的竞争对手。
description.en: An American multinational investment bank and financial services holding company, and a competitor of Goldman Sachs.

description.zh-cn: 马库斯·高德曼于1869年创立了高盛集团公司。
description.en: Marcus Goldman founded The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. in 1869.

description.zh-cn: 塞缪尔·盛赫斯是高盛集团公司的联合创始人。
description.en: Samuel Sachs was a co-founder of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: David M. Solomon (苏德巍) 是高盛集团的董事长兼首席执行官。
description.en: David M. Solomon is the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·沃尔德伦是高盛集团的总裁兼首席运营官。
description.en: John Waldron is the President and Chief Operating Officer of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

position.zh-cn: 执行副总裁兼首席财务官
position.en: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer

description.zh-cn: 史蒂芬·谢尔是高盛集团的执行副总裁兼首席财务官。
description.en: Stephen Scherr is the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 由于在次贷危机期间参与了资产证券化，高盛集团遭受了损失。
description.en: Goldman Sachs suffered losses during the subprime mortgage crisis due to its involvement in asset securitization.

description.zh-cn: 高盛集团在2007年至2008年全球金融危机中遭受损失。
description.en: Goldman Sachs suffered losses in the 2007-2008 global financial crisis.

description.zh-cn: 作为问题资产救助计划的一部分，高盛集团得到了美国财政部100亿美元的投资以帮助其渡过金融危机。
description.en: As part of the Troubled Asset Relief Program, Goldman Sachs received a $10 billion investment from the U.S. Treasury to help it through the financial crisis.

description.zh-cn: 问题资产救助计划源自《经济稳定紧急法案》。
description.en: The Troubled Asset Relief Program originated from the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008.

relationships.source: 一个马来西亚发展有限公司丑闻

description.zh-cn: 因在一马公司丑闻中的角色，高盛同意支付数十亿美元的罚金并与马来西亚政府达成和解。
description.en: Due to its role in the 1MDB scandal, Goldman Sachs agreed to pay billions of dollars in fines and reached a settlement with the Malaysian government.

description.zh-cn: 2022年3月，高盛宣布将逐步结束其在俄罗斯的业务。
description.en: In March 2022, Goldman Sachs announced it would wind down its business in Russia.

description.zh-cn: 高盛在其2003年发布的报告《梦想伴随金砖国家：2050年之路》中介绍了“金砖国家”的概念。
description.en: Goldman Sachs introduced the concept of "BRIC" in its 2003 report, "Dreaming with BRICs: The Path to 2050".

description.zh-cn: 高盛在其2005年发布的报告《金砖国家的势力如何？》中推出了“未来11国”的概念。
description.en: Goldman Sachs introduced the concept of the "Next Eleven" in its 2005 report, "How Solid are the BRICs?"

relationships.source: 高盛 (亚洲) 有限责任公司

description.zh-cn: 高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司是高盛集团在亚洲的业务分支机构。
description.en: Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C. is the Asian business arm of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.en: Jiang Zhicheng previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 张辛亮曾在高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司工作。
description.en: Zhang Xinliang previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 安娜曾在高盛（亚洲）有限责任公司工作。
description.en: Anna previously worked at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C.

description.zh-cn: 摩根士丹利被列为高盛集团的竞争对手。
description.en: Morgan Stanley is listed as a competitor to The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.

description.zh-cn: 摩根大通被列为高盛集团的竞争对手。
description.en: JPMorgan Chase is listed as a competitor to The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc.
